briefdescription.para: Macro for creating a TWIM driver instance.
TWIM driver default configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
This configuration sets up TWIM with the following options:
clock frequency: 100 kHz
disable bus holding after uninit

parameterdescription.para: SCL pin.
SDA pin.

briefdescription.para: Flag indicating that TX buffer address will be incremented after the transfer.
Flag indicating that RX buffer address will be incremented after the transfer.
Flag indicating that the interrupt after each transfer will be suppressed, and the event handler will not be called.
Flag indicating that the transfer will be set up, but not started.
Flag indicating that the transfer will be executed multiple times.
Flag indicating that the TX transfer will not end with a stop condition.
Flag indicating that checks for spurious STOP condition will not be performed.

briefdescription.para: Function for initializing the TWIM driver instance.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the structure with the initial configuration.
Event handler provided by the user. If NULL, blocking mode is enabled.
Context passed to event handler.

simplesect.para: On nRF5340, 1 MHz setting is supported only on the dedicated pins. See the chapter Pin assignments in the Product Specification.

parameterdescription.para: Initialization was successful.
The driver is already initialized.
The driver is already initialized. Deprecated - use NRFX_ERROR_ALREADY instead.
Requested frequency is not available on the specified pins.
Some other peripheral with the same instance ID is already in use. This is possible only if Peripheral Resource Sharing (PRS) module is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling the TWIM instance.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for performing a TWIM transfer.

detaileddescription.para:
The following transfer types can be configured (nrfx_twim_xfer_desc_t::type):
NRFX_TWIM_XFER_TXRX - Write operation followed by a read operation (without STOP condition in between).
NRFX_TWIM_XFER_TXTX - Write operation followed by a write operation (without STOP condition in between).
NRFX_TWIM_XFER_TX - Write operation (with or without STOP condition).
NRFX_TWIM_XFER_RX - Read operation (with STOP condition).

TX-RX and TX-TX transfers are supported only in non-blocking mode.
Additional options are provided using the flags parameter:
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_TX_POSTINC and NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_RX_POSTINC - Post-incrementation of buffer addresses.
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER - No user event handler after the transfer completion. In most cases, this also means no interrupt at the end of the transfer.
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_HOLD_XFER - Driver is not starting the transfer. Use this flag if the transfer is triggered externally by PPI. Use nrfx_twim_start_task_address_get to get the address of the start task.
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER - Prepare for repeated transfers. You can set up a number of transfers that will be triggered externally (for example by PPI). An example is a TXRX transfer with the options NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_RX_POSTINC, NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER, and NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER. After the transfer is set up, a set of transfers can be triggered by PPI that will read, for example, the same register of an external component and put it into a RAM buffer without any interrupts. nrfx_twim_stopped_event_address_get can be used to get the address of the STOPPED event, which can be used to count the number of transfers. If NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER is used, the driver does not set the driver instance into busy state, so you must ensure that the next transfers are set up when TWIM is not active.
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_TX_NO_STOP - No stop condition after the TX transfer.
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_NO_SPURIOUS_STOP_CHECK - Checks for spurious STOP conditions are disabled. Used together with NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER can result in lower power consumption when transfers are triggered externally and CPU is sleeping. Use only with I2C standard-compliant slave devices.

Some flag combinations are invalid:
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_TX_NO_STOP with nrfx_twim_xfer_desc_t::type different than NRFX_TWIM_XFER_TX
NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER with nrfx_twim_xfer_desc_t::type set to NRFX_TWIM_XFER_TXTX
If nrfx_twim_xfer_desc_t::type is set to NRFX_TWIM_XFER_TX and the NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_TX_NO_STOP and NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_REPEATED_XFER flags are set, two tasks must be used to trigger a transfer: TASKS_RESUME followed by TASKS_STARTTX. If no stop condition is generated, TWIM is in SUSPENDED state. Therefore, it must be resumed before the transfer can be started.

simplesect.para: Peripherals using EasyDMA (including TWIM) require the transfer buffers to be placed in the Data RAM region. If this condition is not met, this function will fail with the error code NRFX_ERROR_INVALID_ADDR.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the transfer descriptor.
Transfer options (0 for default settings).
The procedure is successful.
The driver is not ready for a new transfer.
The provided parameters are not supported.
An unexpected transition occurred on the bus.
The provided buffers are not placed in the Data RAM region.
The unread data is replaced by new data.
NACK is received after sending the address.
NACK is received after sending a data byte.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking the TWIM driver state.

parameterdescription.para: TWIM instance.
The TWIM driver is currently busy performing a transfer.
The TWIM driver is ready for a new transfer.

briefdescription.para: Function for returning the address of a TWIM start task.

detaileddescription.para: This function is to be used if nrfx_twim_xfer was called with the flag NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_HOLD_XFER. In that case, the transfer is not started by the driver, but it must be started externally by PPI.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Transfer type used in the last call of the nrfx_twim_xfer function.

simplesect.para: Start task address (TX or RX) depending on the value of xfer_type.

briefdescription.para: Function for returning the address of a STOPPED TWIM event.

detaileddescription.para: A STOPPED event can be used to detect the end of a transfer if the NRFX_TWIM_FLAG_NO_XFER_EVT_HANDLER option is used.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for recovering the bus.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks if the bus is not stuck because of a slave holding the SDA line in the low state, and if needed it performs required number of pulses on the SCL line to make the slave release the SDA line. Finally, the function generates a STOP condition on the bus to put it into a known state.

simplesect.para: This function can be used only if the TWIM driver is uninitialized.

parameterdescription.para: SCL pin number.
SDA pin number.
Bus recovery was successful.
Bus recovery failed.
